Robin Rendle
NotesEssaysAdventures
March 10, 2021 • San Francisco, California

Click, click, click

One thing I love about Sentry is that it's an open source project which means that you can go ahead and look at every line of code I've written over the past year.

You can see me slowly refactoring our typography, deleting unused bootstrap CSS, and replacing our old coding font, Monaco, with IBM Plex.

Click, click, click.

I don’t know why this is so exciting but perhaps it’s because it feels like blogging, in a way. There’s this warm feeling I get when working/blogging/typing like this in public, a feeling where we can all learn from each other and how we’re all just figuring out how to type better.

I get this same feeling reading through my RSS feed; constant improvement and momentum, without being unhealthy.
